messages.message: Hello Team, Could someone please look at the admin diagnostic app? I was trying this on a 23.10 sbx and it is failing with same problem as customer's. Looks like the test_root_path value that we allow the user to pick from the picker_utils does not pass that off to the init class to begin with and it fails. After I skimmed through the code path, it looked good to me, so I ran the POST /system-test API directly via postman with proper input and I got all success. Details and evidences in the thread.

Because of this missing root_test_folder_path, it fails with this error right in few seconds:
```Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/instabase/workers/celery-app-tasks/py/instabase_test/test_model_operations.py", line 77, in setUpClass
    cls.user.copy_local_dir(f'{cls.local_input_path}/input',
  File "/instabase/workers/celery-app-tasks/py/instabase_test/system_utils/system_test_user.py", line 833, in copy_local_dir
    self.mkdir(ib_dirpath, use_cookies=use_cookies)
  File "/instabase/workers/celery-app-tasks/py/instabase_test/system_utils/system_test_user.py", line 2528, in mkdir
    return super().mkdir(dir_path, exp_ok, use_cookies)
  File "/instabase/workers/celery-app-tasks/py/instabase_test/system_utils/system_test_user.py", line 242, in mkdir
    self.assertIsNone(err)
  File "/pyenv/versions/3.9.17/lib/python3.9/unittest/case.py", line 1247, in assertIsNone
    self.fail(self._formatMessage(msg, standardMsg))
  File "/pyenv/versions/3.9.17/lib/python3.9/unittest/case.py", line 676, in fail
    raise self.failureException(msg)
AssertionError: '404 Not Found: The requested URL was not found on the server. If you entered the URL manually please check your spelling and try again.' is not None```
Thanks for reporting. Taking a look soon
